Anoint: (v) rub or sprinkle oil on; make sacred, such as by ceremony that includes applying oil to someone
Anarchy: (n) absence of law or government; chaos, disorder
Ambiguous: (adj) not clear, hard to understand, open to having several meanings or interpretations
Ambivalent: (adj) uncertain; unable to decide, or wanting to do two contradictory things at once
Anomaly: (n) deviation from what is common; inconsistency
Alienate: (v) cause to become unfriendly, hostile, or distant
Analogous: (adj) comparable, corresponding in some particular way (making a good analogy)
Apathy: (n) not caring; absence of feeling; lack of interest or concern
